You cannot turn the economy around without the scientific leadership on it. -NP https://twitter.com/newday/status/1255841994506735617 QT @NewDay “I myself think the path to our re-entering the economy is testing, testing, testing,” says @SpeakerPelosi, adding that people would feel confident in returning to work when others have been tested too.
“You cannot turn the economy around without the scientific leadership on it.” http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1255841875765927937/img/V-I7NkuKJjc40JJq.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1255841875765927937/vid/480x270/aysSb2q6kszGfV29.mp4?tag=13

Another example of why #PPPworks 

After a 70% drop in sales, a family-owned hardware store in #Macomb #Illinois applied for a #PPPloan. 

Now, this #smallbiz will be able to keep all of its employees paid. 

https://wgem.com/2020/04/28/paycheck-protection-program-helps-macomb-businesses-amid-pandemic/#.XqrIDBrRH8Q.twitter

30 million Americans have sought unemployment aid in the last 6 week. 

Imagine what that number would be if well over 2 million #PPPloans weren’t provided employers cash to keep workers on payroll.

This is why #PPP is so important. https://twitter.com/ap/status/1255837450053857281 QT @AP BREAKING: 3.8 million workers seek US unemployment aid, raising total layoffs since virus hit hard to 30 million. https://apnews.com/VirusOutbreak?utm_medium=AP&utm_source=Twitter&utm_campaign=SocialFlow

If an eligible media outlet gets a #PPPloan it means they are keep American’s on payroll. That is the purpose of #PPP & not a conflict of interest. 

Does a journalist who was able to get a degree due to federal financial aid have a conflict of interest? https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/29/business/news-media-federal-aid-coronavirus.html?referringSource=articleShare
.@HUDgov allocated more than $143 million coronavirus relief funds to #Florida state and local governments, including over $45 million to help homeless citizens. #sayfie

Horrific. That a non-violent drug offense became a death sentence for a woman who was 8.5 months pregnant is tragic and unacceptable. Andrea should be alive with her newborn right now. Congress must act to pass the Emergency Community Supervision Act. https://www.nytimes.com/reuters/2020/04/28/us/28reuters-health-coronavirus-usa-prisons.html

Companies from #China listed on U.S. exchanges face different standards than companies headquartered anywhere else. 

They are widely shielded by from the full oversight of our regulators. 

Several months ago I filed a bipartisan bill to change that.
 https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/30/business/luckin-coffee-china-fraud-wall-street.html?referringSource=articleShare

Let’s treat essential frontline workers as heroes, not just call them heroes. Cancel student debt now. https://twitter.com/theintercept/status/1253462170110758912 QT @theintercept Almost 70% of all nurses — who staff the truest front line in this pandemic — graduate from training with $40,000  to $150,000 in debt. https://trib.al/w61gTdg

RT @LHM The Larry H. Miller Group of Companies is joining together with @utahfoodbank to help our neighbors:  April 30 - May 6 from 2-6pm. Our dealerships, theatres, and venues will become donation sites for nonperishable food items. https://www.lhm.com/driven-to-assist/  #DriventoAssist http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EWyHgE-WsAAdieH.jpg

Tonight, join me, @ewarren, @PramilaJayapal and @MarkPocan for a livestream on our shared priorities for the next coronavirus relief package. Tune in at 7 p.m. ET at http://live.berniesanders.com. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EW2pGUgWoAAZjGB.jpg

Today, I'm announcing my new bill to create a COVID-19 Racial and Ethnic Disparities Task Force.

We need a serious, targeted effort to address the reality that Black and brown people are disproportionately being infected and dying from COVID-19 across the nation. https://twitter.com/BuzzFeedNews/status/1255846916816097281 QT @BuzzFeedNews Sen. Kamala Harris will introduce legislation to create a task force to address the racial disparity in coronavirus cases and deaths https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/kadiagoba/sen-kamala-harris-is-introducing-a-bill-to-address-the?bftwnews&utm_term=4ldqpgc#4ldqpgc
Tune in as I discuss the ongoing efforts to protect American lives, livelihoods, and the life of our democracy. #FamiliesFirst https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1DXxyeebAwWxM

Absolutely devastating—more than 30 million Americans have filed for unemployment since this crisis started. 

A one time $1,200 payment is nowhere near enough for folks struggling to pay rent and feed their families. We need recurring payments and more money for food assistance.
A whole lot of people in America have been sleeping on the danger that #China poses... @MichaelJKnowles and I discuss in the latest episode of #Verdict: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h3PQ3MQ5j7A

Payroll tax cuts don't help people who are unemployed. Additional stimulus payments are the best way to get cash directly into the hands of those who need it. https://twitter.com/JStein_WaPo/status/1255224002601254914 QT @JStein_WaPo Trump comes out AGAINST additional stimulus checks for  millions of Americans

Instead says, "I like the idea of payroll tax cuts." Adds economists would agree with him. I reported recently Trump has been talking late at night w/ Art Laffer, supply side economist
I will be holding my weekly press conference at 10:45 am ET as House & Senate Democrats continue fighting to put #FamiliesFirst nationwide. https://www.facebook.com/NancyPelosi/

In the last six weeks 30 million Americans have filed for unemployment.

That is catastrophic and unprecedented.

Instead of giveaways to profitable corporations, Congress must continue paychecks to unemployed workers and ensure health care for all. https://twitter.com/ABC/status/1255840177441906689 QT @ABC BREAKING: Last week 3.8 million Americans filed for unemployment insurance, the Department of Labor said, bringing the total to 30 million in six weeks. https://trib.al/TPMkK6J

Actually, paragraph 10 of UNSCR 2231 encourages the US to resolve disputes *through the Iran nuclear deal* – the same one you withdrew from, limiting our options and making us less safe. Nice try, @SecPompeo.
 
But can I put you down for reentering the #IranDeal? https://twitter.com/SecPompeo/status/1255850232946057218 QT @SecPompeo .@SenWarren, you should review the law again — our rights under UNSCR 2231 are separate from the JCPOA. But I’ll put you down for Chinese arms sales to Iran on October 18.  Which weapons is it okay with you if they send? A couple of divisions of VT-4 tanks good?

RT @Jerusalem_Post The Jewish Institute of National Security for America (JINSA) held a phone conference with Senator @tedcruz (R-TX) on Wednesday to discuss further US-Israel cooperation in fighting the #coronavirus pandemic in their respective countries together.

https://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Senator-Ted-Cruz-Israels-enemies-are-Americas-enemies-626392

30 million lost their jobs in six weeks.

We are the only major country with millions unemployed and uninsured.

It's time to reexamine our society's foundations and fight for a more just nation.

This is the moment to make sure everyone has economic security and health care. https://twitter.com/cnnbrk/status/1255840359470563328 QT @cnnbrk Another 3.8 million Americans filed for first-time unemployment benefits last week, bringing the total claims since mid-March to more than 30 million https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/30/economy/unemployment-benefits-coronavirus/index.html http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EW2kFShXQAERwVc.jpg

Encouraged to see the Fed taking these steps. Without providing this lifeline, the US risks bankrupting energy producers, adding hundreds of thousands of blue-collar workers to the 30M+ Americans who have already lost their jobs as a result of #COVID19. https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-30/fed-expands-eligibility-for-its-main-street-lending-program

The federal government must use its full manufacturing, contracting, & coordinating capacity to fight COVID-19 head-on. That’s what my public manufacturing bill with @JanSchakowsky will do. Congress should act by including this bill in the next relief package.

Our bill authorizes the federal govt to manufacture, or contract to manufacture, key equipment & supplies for federal, state, local, & tribal health programs at no cost to them. And it will start manufacturing facilities to make COVID-19 vaccines at scale when they are available.

President Trump still doesn’t have a plan to get our health care workers the COVID-19 supplies they need. But @JanSchakowsky & I do. We have a bill to publicly manufacture PPE, drugs, & other medical supplies needed to fight this pandemic. https://www.vox.com/2020/4/30/21241842/coronavirus-covid-supply-shortages-ppe-elizabeth-warren

Yesterday we had our second virtual townhall with ⁦@ShevrinJones⁩ & ⁦@oscarjb2⁩ 

#Sayfie 

Video link below:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hugwbiQh9Do&feature=youtu.be

The consequences of this economic shutdown are serious and dire, from poverty and hunger to substance abuse and mental illness. We need to safely re-open the economy and help Americans return to work. Human lives depend on it. https://twitter.com/AP/status/1255837450053857281 QT @AP BREAKING: 3.8 million workers seek US unemployment aid, raising total layoffs since virus hit hard to 30 million. https://apnews.com/VirusOutbreak?utm_medium=AP&utm_source=Twitter&utm_campaign=SocialFlow

Data alone is not enough. The federal government has a responsibility to direct information & resources to communities being devastated by this virus. We want to know how the COVID-19 Task Force plans to address these racial & other demographic disparities. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EW4UrTZXgAAzaWW.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EW4UszvWAAkSLSN.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EW4UtonWAAQuqaA.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EW4UupOWAAc2355.png

Structural racism has kept people of color from accessing health care, safe & affordable housing, & financial security. The incomplete data show that Black & Brown communities are suffering & dying more from this virus because of those inequities. https://www.democrats.senate.gov/dpcc/press-reports/dpcc-report-racial-disparities-on-full-displaycovid-19-is-disproportionately-affecting-communities-of-color

For weeks, @RepPressley & I have fought hard for @CDCgov to collect & report COVID-19 demographic data. So far the data expose deep inequities for communities of color. The federal govt now must act to help those being hit hardest by this pandemic. https://www.pbs.org/newshour/nation/democrats-pen-letters-to-pence-and-cdc-urging-immediate-steps-to-address-covid-19s-racial-disparities
